channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Breaking News: U.S. police killings were undercounted by more than 17,000 over the past 40 years, a new study found, raising questions about the racial bias of medical examiners and their role in obscuring the real extent of police violence. https://t.co/C4lMqSDYei https://t.co/R0UiW9kFHJ

The man who opened fire in a synagogue north of San Diego in 2019, killing a 60-year-old woman and injuring three others during the Jewish holiday of Passover, was sentenced on Thursday to life in prison without the possibility of parole. https://t.co/mDQFV4yIcP
They're bears. They're big. And they spent all summer preparing (eating) to get ready for this very week. Fat Bear Week is back. https://t.co/ouHGyDaQFS
A House committee scrutinizing the Jan. 6 attack issued 11 more subpoenas, targeting Trump allies who helped organize the rally that fueled mob violence. https://t.co/5gfy8bNtEx

AT&T announced on Wednesday that it was extending its coronavirus vaccination requirement to tens of thousands of employees who are members of the Communications Workers of America union. https://t.co/Kat3Wt0TEm

"Whoever does it, good luck to them," Daniel Craig said of the next James Bond. With "No Time to Die," the actor bids farewell to the spy he’s played since 2006. https://t.co/o9PXqgcuID https://t.co/AoWctDkmwT

California’s requirement that all health care workers be vaccinated against the coronavirus by Thursday appears to have compelled tens of thousands of unvaccinated employees to get shots in recent weeks.
Here's what the data shows. https://t.co/zGyYnYNZ47

91% of the workforce at Tyson Foods is fully vaccinated against the coronavirus, the company said. Two months ago, Tyson announced a vaccine mandate for all 120,000 of its U.S. employees, including frontline workers. https://t.co/VKsUv9OvHy

“I will never vote for her again."
Senator Kyrsten Sinema is facing a growing political revolt at home from the voters who once counted themselves among her most devoted supporters. https://t.co/ex88whZFhY

A French court convicted Nicolas Sarkozy, the former president, on charges that he illegally financed his failed 2012 re-election campaign by wildly exceeding France’s strict electoral spending limits. https://t.co/gII8IkItap

Britney Spears will be without her father’s oversight for the first time since 2008, a Los Angeles judge ruled, as the singer moves toward terminating her conservatorship altogether. https://t.co/tw37kb6eRu

The ivory-billed woodpecker. The Bachman’s warbler. The song of the Kauai O’o, a Hawaiian forest bird.
These are just three of the 22 animals that should be declared extinct, U.S. wildlife officials plan to announce. https://t.co/KVabMMKfOL
U.S. officials declared more than 20 extinctions amid a global environmental crisis. A million more species are at risk, many within decades. https://t.co/OQ0JpNcfbI

"Whoever does it, good luck to them," Daniel Craig said of the next James Bond.
With “No Time to Die,” the actor bids farewell to the spy he’s played since 2006. “Maybe I’ll be remembered as the Grumpy Bond,” he said. “But I’m quite satisfied with that.” https://t.co/l8HrPBxvOs
Fat Bear Week, an annual contest to crown a champion among hundreds of hefty bears in Alaska's Katmai National Park and Preserve, has returned. Here’s what to know. https://t.co/BCZqO9Fh46

In Opinion
Workers "have every right not to get vaccinated — but they don’t have the right to keep jobs in which they needlessly endanger those around them," writes @MaraGay. https://t.co/h2ytNC0fkj

Veterinarians, ranchers and farmers say they are struggling with the effects of the surging demand for the animal deworming drug ivermectin, as misinformation that it is effective at treating Covid-19 runs rampant. https://t.co/6HriqpNF3h https://t.co/UBlKku9aoi

For the first time since 2008, Britney Spears will be without her father’s oversight, a Los Angeles judge has ruled, as the singer moves toward terminating her conservatorship altogether. https://t.co/10mdgixcAE

The Biden administration on Wednesday restored protections for migratory birds, repealing a Trump-era rule that protected oil, construction and other industries from liability if they killed or injured birds while doing business. https://t.co/e5eloim4S8
Breaking News: A judge suspended Britney Spears's father from her conservatorship, creating a path to end his legal authority over her finances. https://t.co/Wz4f8iB0od https://t.co/hBPKa4XL1g
Fat Bear Week, an annual contest to crown a champion among hundreds of hefty bears in Alaska's Katmai National Park and Preserve, has returned. Here’s what to know. https://t.co/jDbcWIwaxT

Americans who received a third Covid vaccine dose in recent weeks reported similar side effects as their second shots and at roughly the same rate, the CDC said on Tuesday, a reassuring sign as more people prepare to receive booster shots. https://t.co/u3P0hkHw5M

To live longer and healthier, it's more important to exercise than it is to lose weight, according to a new review of studies on the relationships between fitness, weight, heart health and longevity. https://t.co/5H6Bru5547
One person has the power to decide whether Britney Spears will remain in the conservatorship controlled by her father: Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Brenda Penny. https://t.co/CJPqt7SRIY

United Airlines, which had said employees would have to show proof of vaccination against the coronavirus, said it is firing about 600 people, or less than 1% of its U.S. work force of 67,000, for not complying with the requirement. https://t.co/p2j79JaC1V

Hundreds of thousands of acres of land in northeast Australia, including the world-famous Daintree Rainforest, were returned on Wednesday to Aboriginal people who have lived in the region for more than 50,000 years. https://t.co/Y8CVXbnW2j

A new generation has become engrossed by "The Sopranos," the early 2000s hit. Its creator, David Chase, told @willystaley about how it captured a country in decline — where things had become so selfish and narcissistic, that even the mob couldn’t take it. https://t.co/TYb5kF2UWc

Daniel Craig will leave his role as Ian Fleming's secret agent James Bond after "No Time to Die" and return to Broadway where he'll play Shakespeare's Scottish King in "Macbeth." https://t.co/u4fRxrPeUl
Breaking News: YouTube is banning several prominent anti-vaccine activists as part of an effort to remove all vaccine misinformation from its platform. https://t.co/fBAy4aLxLN
From the classroom to writing one of the fall's most anticipated books, Jocelyn Nicole Johnson is 50 and just getting started. https://t.co/zI0Sm16JXW
United Airlines is terminating about 600 employees for refusing to comply with its vaccination requirement, the company announced. https://t.co/j3HF96c5GY
Canada has doubled to 40,000 the number of Afghans fleeing the Taliban that it plans to take in, fulfilling a campaign pledge made by Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. https://t.co/EBj85UVExf

In a tiny village on the outskirts of Nacajuca, Mexico, builders are creating new homes for those living in poverty using a novel tool: an oversize 3-D printer. https://t.co/JlFGMWWC4Y https://t.co/cM1Z2nIT5c

More than 3.5 billion people worldwide have received a dose of a Covid-19 vaccine, equal to about 45% of the world population. But ten months after mass vaccination campaigns began, the global rollout remains unequal. https://t.co/RogWclttO6

LeBron James said Tuesday that he had been vaccinated against the coronavirus, after evading questions about his status last season. But he added that he would not use his platform to publicly encourage others to be vaccinated. https://t.co/sBFD8qVK6z

During the pandemic, teenage girls took on more caregiving at home, extra shifts at work and the burden of organizing racial justice protests. In many instances, it upended their lives. https://t.co/H8aXmOWvK0
More than four years after leaving office, Barack Obama broke ground on Tuesday on his presidential center on the South Side of Chicago. https://t.co/KhvbDTUVFP

Top U.S. military officers on Tuesday acknowledged publicly for the first time that they had advised President Biden not to withdraw all American troops from Afghanistan ahead of the evacuation. https://t.co/kmQuHjbzH7 https://t.co/8Ui0UDhTkl

At the now-vegan Eleven Madison Park, one dish involves a beet "doing things no root vegetable should be asked to do," @pete_wells writes. "The ingredients look normal until you take a bite and realize you’ve entered the plant kingdom’s uncanny valley." https://t.co/iszd7IApA2

Top U.S. military officers on Tuesday acknowledged publicly for the first time that they had advised President Biden not to withdraw all American forces from Afghanistan ahead of the chaotic evacuation during which 13 U.S. service members were killed. https://t.co/mP11QpXjM5

Donald Trump's former press secretary, Stephanie Grisham, accuses the former president of abusing his staff, placating President Vladimir Putin of Russia and making sexual comments about a White House aide.
Here are more details from her new book: https://t.co/vtzzdiwprs

Gen. Mark Milley on Tuesday defended calls he made to China at the end of Donald Trump’s term as president, saying top administration officials were aware of them. https://t.co/iRPnv9U2Ea https://t.co/fP9C3ST7Xw

This year’s 25 winners of the MacArthur Fellowship include Ibram X. Kendi, who wrote "How to Be an Antiracist," the poet Hanif Abdurraqib and the writer and curator Nicole Fleetwood. https://t.co/VxHzMMzhh7

Gen. Mark Milley told senators on Tuesday that calls to his Chinese counterpart and a meeting in which he told generals to alert him if Donald Trump tried to launch a nuclear weapon were part of his duties as the country’s most senior military officer. https://t.co/MlXbsTvOgk https://t.co/rGfRmzXxGK

An influential and divisive shaman in Sri Lanka, who claimed to be able to cure coronavirus patients with holy water, died last week after being infected with the virus, officials said. https://t.co/uJgkjklBjm

Pfizer and BioNTech will submit a formal request to the U.S. regulators to allow a pediatric dose of their coronavirus vaccine to be administered to children ages 5 to 11, the companies said on Tuesday. https://t.co/tIzFK2KV6Q
Canada has doubled to 40,000 the number of Afghans fleeing the Taliban that it plans to take in, fulfilling a campaign pledge made by Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. https://t.co/wLNzcePK24

Breaking News: Donald Trump has lost an effort to enforce a nondisclosure agreement against Omarosa Manigault Newman, a former White House aide and a star on “The Apprentice” who wrote a tell-all book about serving in his administration. https://t.co/Qwuyc38fmC

School officials in a Missouri city stocked up on frozen pizzas and hot dogs. A Kansas school district ran out of vegetables last month. Another in Minnesota has an emergency supply of frozen grilled cheese sandwiches, in case it runs out of other food. https://t.co/WYoNQo2TGh

Michelle Bolsonaro, the wife of Jair Bolsonaro, Brazil's proudly unvaccinated president, opted to get vaccinated last week during their visit to New York for the UN General Assembly. https://t.co/1Y7TC7pZsh
